description: Indicates the total number of successful user logons during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Helps identify the number of users successfully accessing the system.

description: Indicates the total number of failed user logons during the last measurement period.
interpretation: High values may indicate incorrect credentials or potential security issues.
troubleshootingSteps: Check if users are entering correct credentials.
Investigate if there are any ongoing brute force attacks or system issues.

description: Indicates the average time taken for a user to log on successfully.
interpretation: High values may indicate system slowness or backend authentication delays.
troubleshootingSteps: Analyze backend authentication services for delays.
Check network latency and server performance.

description: Indicates the number of users logging on concurrently during the last measurement period.
interpretation: Helps understand peak usage times and system load.

description: Indicates the percentage of logon attempts that resulted in errors.
interpretation: High values may indicate widespread issues with the logon process.
troubleshootingSteps: Investigate common error patterns in logon failures.
Ensure authentication services are operational and properly configured.
